snippet: Mario Monti said Friday that Greece’s government had made a “remarkable effort” to reach new austerity agreements with lenders to avoid a calamitous default.
abstract: Italian Prime Min Mario Monti praises the Greek government's efforts to reach new austerity agreements with lenders to avoid a calamitous default; predicts that the euro zone will survive, in part because it is in the interests of Germany, its biggest and strongest member.
lead_paragraph: Mario Monti said Friday that Greece’s government had made a “remarkable effort” to reach new austerity agreements with lenders to avoid a calamitous default.

headline.seo: Italy’s Leader Is Optimistic About Greece and Euro
headline.main: Italy’s Prime Minister Offers Praise for Greece and Optimism About Euro Zone
headline.print_headline: Italy’s Prime Minister Offers Praise for Greece and Optimism About Euro Zone
